user.title: Choose a name for the Adaptive Lighting instance
user.description: Pick a name for this instance. You can run several instances of Adaptive lighting, each of these can contain multiple lights!

init.title: Adaptive Lighting options
init.description: All settings for a Adaptive Lighting component. The option names correspond with the YAML settings. No options are shown if you have the adaptive_lighting entry defined in your YAML configuration.

data.max_brightness: max_brightness: Highest brightness of lights during a cycle. (%)
data.max_color_temp: max_color_temp: Coldest hue of the color temperature cycle. (Kelvin)
data.min_brightness: min_brightness: Lowest brightness of lights during a cycle. (%)
data.min_color_temp: min_color_temp, Warmest hue of the color temperature cycle. (Kelvin)
data.only_once: only_once: Only adapt the lights when turning them on.
data.prefer_rgb_color: prefer_rgb_color: Use 'rgb_color' rather than 'color_temp' when possible.
data.separate_turn_on_commands: separate_turn_on_commands: Separate the commands for each attribute (color, brightness, etc.) in 'light.turn_on' (required for some lights).
data.sleep_brightness: sleep_brightness, Brightness setting for Sleep Mode. (%)
data.sleep_color_temp: sleep_color_temp: Color temperature setting for Sleep Mode. (Kelvin)
data.sunrise_offset: sunrise_offset: How long before(-) or after(+) to define the sunrise point of the cycle (+/- seconds)
data.sunrise_offset_color: sunrise_offset color: How long before(-) or after(+) to define the sunrise point of the cycle (+/- seconds)
data.sunrise_time: sunrise_time: Manual override of the sunrise time, if 'None', it uses the actual sunrise time at your location (HH:MM:SS)
data.sunset_offset: sunset_offset: How long before(-) or after(+) to define the sunset point of the cycle (+/- seconds)
data.sunset_offset_color: sunset_offset: How long before(-) or after(+) to define the sunset point of the cycle (+/- seconds)
data.sunset_time: sunset_time: Manual override of the sunset time, if 'None', it uses the actual sunrise time at your location (HH:MM:SS)
data.take_over_control: take_over_control: If anything but Adaptive Lighting calls 'light.turn_on' when a light is already on, stop adapting that light until it (or the switch) toggles off -> on.
data.detect_non_ha_changes: detect_non_ha_changes: detects all >10% changes made to the lights (also outside of HA), requires 'take_over_control' to be enabled (calls 'homeassistant.update_entity' every 'interval'!)
data.transition: Transition time when applying a change to the lights (seconds)
